    James H.

    Enabling Zero Trust Powered by Envoy and Istio | Service Mesh

    1mo

    Tetrate is excited to give you a peek into Tetrate Service Express, a service connectivity, security and resilience automation solution for Amazon EKS. Join Owen Garrett, Product Lead for Tetrate Service Express, as he gives a deep dive into this innovative tool and its benefits for EKS users who want to run a service mesh based on Istio and Envoy. Tetrate Service Express offers a management plane on top of open source service mesh components such as Istio and Envoy, optimizing them for easy installation, configuration and operation on AWS. If your team is experimenting with service mesh on AWS and you need to quickly prove the ROI, take a look at Tetrate Service Express. If your team already has a service mesh on a single cluster, but want to extend your mesh to multiple clusters or even regions, Tetrate Service Express is also a great tool for you. In this webinar you will learn: How to enforce mTLS with a default "deny all" policy in one step How to achieve failover of services across EKS clusters How to Inspect traffic and traces in near-real-time #servicemesh #aws #eks #istio #envoy

    Marc Morata Fit√©

    Building Zero Trust Powered by Envoy and Istio | 2021 Gartner Cool Vendor

    3mo

    CRE : Customer Reliability Engineer(ing)... I feel this term is in a similar stage, that DevOps was a few years ago, differences aside. Why do I say so? When interviewing candidates, I see people with CRE titles doing a big range of tasks, but none related to the reliability of the customer's environment. For many companies, CRE is exchangeable with Customer Support and it's not. What is CRE goal? Make your Customer Support scalable. They will enable your organization to grow and not drown with incidents from your customers. Let's just have a quick flashback... CRE is a reaction to companies trying to apply the SRE methodology when they do not own the entire stack. You still want to create reliable platforms but your options are limited. This is when CRE comes to play, helping the SRE's team on the customer side to create reliable services for their users. What does it mean? Whatever it takes to make them successful... It could be developing a new integration, a new tool, extending an existing one, etc ... Profile for a successful CRE? Strong operations understanding and coding. If you think you have what it takes, we are hiring for multiple positions, including CRE. https://lnkd.in/esMzR6nc #cre #customerexperience #customersuccess #customersupport #support #istio #kubernetes

    Careers

    https://tetrate.io
